result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin Lee Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment/counseling.

Absolute sobriety. 
No possession/consumption of alcohol, controlled substance without a valid Rx and/or drug paraphernalia.

Anger management/domestic violence assessment and follow through.
No domestic disturbances.
Take all medication as prescribed by Dr and approved by DOC agent.
Court costs of $363 and DNA surcharge of $200 payable w/ cash bond posted. Submit DNA sample. Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation.

timeConds.notes: Report on a Friday by 6pm and release on a Monday at 6am. DOC agent to arrange date to report. Must be served within 90 days of sentencing date 7/6/2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin Lee Smith

records.addlTxt: Check # 024838  payable to poster of bond mailed 7/11/2022

10:34 AM Defendant Dustin Lee Smith in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Dustin Lee Smith. Attorney.  Attorney Lawrence Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rachael Race/ VWC in court. Victim rights. Victim makes stmt. Court makes stmt. Plea negotiations filed on 7/5/2022 doc #23 reviewed w/ counsel and defendant. Defendant waives reading of count 1 in 22CM11 and court reviews the charge. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 1. Count 2 dismissed/read-in. PLQ received/reviewed by the Court. Court finds defendant's plea to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the plea. Factual basis found. Adjudged guilty. Victim rights. Victim makes stmt. Court makes stmt. State's recommendation. Atty Spansail makes stmt. Victim makes stmt. Court makes stmt. Court sentence. 22CM11: Count 1, imposed/stayed 9 months county jail, placed on DOC probation for 18 months, 1 weekend in jail Friday from 6pm - Monday 6am (DOC agent to arrange but must be done w/ in the next 90 days), AODA assessment and follow through w/ all recommendations, absolute sobriety, anger management/domestic violence assessment and follow through, no domestic disturbances, no possession of alcohol, controlled substance w/out valid Rx and/or drug paraphernalia, court costs of $363 and DNA surcharge of $200 payable w/ cash bond posted, submit DNA sample. 21CM3: withheld sentence, convert VIP probation to state probation for a period of 18 months w/ same conditions. If VIP fees owed, defendant still needs to pay the fees to VIP. Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation. Default of payment debt referred to SDC.
Addendum to Plea Forms -Summary Plea Negotiations
No restitution claim letter filed by VWC Race
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Phone call from Atty Spansail and Debbie/DA's office rescheduled the P&S that was set on 6/2/2022 at 2pm to 7/6/2022 at 10:30am. This was rescheduled at the request of the DA he was double booked.

off record. Defendant Dustin Lee Smith in court with attorney Jon G Spansail.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Joe L/VIP agent in court. Court reviews Petition and Order Extending VIP for case #21CM3 and signs the Order.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Phone call from Atty Spansail and Jordan/DA's office rescheduled the PTC that was set on 3/17/2022 at 2pm to 4/25/2022 at 10:30am, this was rescheduled at the request of Atty Spansail.
Pre-trial conference on March 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Email from Atty Spansail and Jordan/DA's office - rescheduled the STC that was set on 4/14/2022 at 2pm to 3/17/2022 at 2pm, this was rescheduled at the request of the DA.
